PERSONA:
Alex Thompson, a 38-year-old white male, living in Cheyenne, Wyoming. He is in a long-term, unmarried partnership with his female partner, Sarah, who is the primary breadwinner in the household. They reside in a modest, rented townhouse in a mixed-income neighborhood, paying $900 per month. Alex is not currently employed, having taken a break from his previous job as a sales associate at a local outdoor gear store to focus on his health and personal projects. His last job paid approximately $28,000 per year. 

Alex attended Laramie County Community College for two years, studying environmental science but did not complete his degree. He has been actively involved in local environmental activism, participating in community clean-up initiatives and advocating for sustainable practices in Cheyenne.

Although Alex is not in the labor force, he spends a significant amount of time volunteering for local organizations and managing the household chores. His partner, Sarah, works as a registered nurse at Cheyenne Regional Medical Center, earning around $62,000 annually.

Alex's economic concerns include access to affordable healthcare, as he has been dealing with chronic health issues that have affected his ability to work full-time. He also worries about the impact of climate change on Wyoming's environment and economy. Alex is a registered voter and has voted in local elections, prioritizing candidates who support environmental protection and social welfare policies.
